biography.summary: Charles E. Schumer is the senior United States Senator from New York and has served as the Senate Majority Leader since 2021. He has represented New York in the U.S. Senate since 1999 and previously served in the U.S. House of Representatives from 1981 to 1999.
biography.early_life: Born November 23, 1950, in Brooklyn, New York.
biography.education: Not publicly specified in this dataset.
biography.career: Long-time public servant and legislator who has held leadership roles in the Senate and represented New York at the federal level for decades.

contact.office_address: 322 Hart Senate Office Building, Washington DC 20510

policy_positions.stance: Support comprehensive tax reform including incentives for investment and growth.
Support strengthening the Affordable Care Act and protecting coverage.
Support comprehensive immigration reform and a path to citizenship for undocumented immigrants.

bills_sponsored.title: USA Freedom and Security Enhancement Act
bills_sponsored.summary: Proposes measures to enhance national security and information sharing among agencies.

bills_sponsored.title: Affordable Care Improvement Act
bills_sponsored.summary: Aims to improve access to health care and reduce costs.

timeline.event: Elected to the U.S. House of Representatives for New York's 16th district.
Elected to the U.S. Senate representing New York.

videos.title: Schumer on the Senate floor: budget reconciliation
